annotations.text:
Goal: Log into and interact with the host at 10.0.7.138.
Tool: The "ssh" command included with OpenSSH
Subtool: "logout" command
Result: successResult

Goal: End Asciinema recording
Tool: The "EOF" character is sent to "exit" of the shell recording session (by pressing control+D on the user's keyboard).
Result: successResult

Goal: Update cached Debian package lists on the system
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "update" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Discovery: The "contrib" and "non-free" repositories are enabled against the user's wishes.
Result: successUnknown

Goal: Remove the "contrib" and "non-free" repositories from "/etc/apt/sources.list"
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "emacs" editor is invoked from the command-line.
Result: successResult

Goal: Update cached Debian package lists on the system
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "update" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Result: successResult

Goal: Upgrade Debian packages installed on the system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Result: successUnknown; user interrupts the process before the upgrade can begin.

Goal: Upgrade Debian packages installed on the system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Discovery: There is a conflicting Python file in the "libgio-2.0-dev-bin" package that causes the upgrade to fail.
Result: successFailure

Goal: Try and force the Debian system upgrade through.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager is invoked with a "--force-overwrite" flag.
Mistake: The "--force-overwrite" flag does not exist
Result: successFailure

Goal: Tell Debian's packager to finish processing pending upgrades
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dpkg" packager command is used with the "--configure" and "-a" flags.
Discovery: Many packages are broken.
Result: successFailure

Goal: Upgrade Debian packages installed on the system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Discovery: Packages are still broken.
Result: successFailure

Goal: Fix broken packages on the Debian system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "install" subcommand of the "apt" package manager is invoked with the "--fix-broken" flag.
Result: successResult

Goal: Double-check that all of the broken packages are fixed.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "install" subcommand of the "apt" package manager is invoked with the "--fix-broken" flag.
Discovery: Several packages are installed that are no longer required.
Result: successResult

Goal: Tell the system's Debian packager to remove unused packages.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "autoremove" subcommand of the "apt" package management command is used.
Result: successResult

Goal: Upgrade Debian packages installed on the system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Discovery: The system does not have enough space to complete the upgrade.
Result: successFailure

Goal: Inspect how much space is left on the system's disks
Tool: The "df" command.
Result: successResult

Goal: Search the "/boot" partition on the system for unused kernels/initramfs images that we can uninstall.
Tool: The "ls" command is invoked on "/boot" with the "-l" and "-a" flags.
Discovery: There are a few kernels and images that can be uninstalled.
Result: successResult

Goal: List Linux image packages installed from the Debian packager.
Tool: The "dpkg" with the "-l" flag is used to list packages.
Subtool: The "grep" command is used to search output from "dpkg" to find packages matching the term "linux-image".
Discovery: There are many kernel images that can be uninstalled.
Result: successResult

Goal: Get the running kernel version, to ensure we don't uninstall it.
Tool: The "uname" command is invoked with the "-a" flag.
Discovery: We are running Linux kernel version 6.6.13-amd64
Result: successResult

Goal: Purge all kernel packages, save for 6.6.13-amd64 and the latest one.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
The "dpkg" command is called with the "--purge" flag on each kernel package, one by one.
Result: successResult

Goal: Make sure that all pending packages are finished processing.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dpkg" packager command is used with the "--configure" and "-a" flags.
Result: successResult

Goal: Upgrade Debian packages installed on the system.
Tool: The "sudo" command elevates the privileges for "demo".
Subtool: The "dist-upgrade" subcommand of the "apt" package manager.
Result: successResult

Goal: List installed packages on the system.
Tool: The "dpkg" command with the "-l" flag is used to list packages
Subtool: The "cat" command receives the "dpkg" output in a pipe to keep "dpkg" from calling a pager.
Result: successResult

Goal: Log out of the SSH shell session.
Tool: The "EOF" character is sent to "logout" of the shell session (by pressing control+D on the user's keyboard).
Result: successResult

Goal: Enter demo@10.0.7.138's password
Tool: Interactive password prompt from earlier "ssh" command
Secrets: passwordPrompt
Result: successResult

Goal: Enter demo@10.0.7.138's password
Tool: Interactive password prompt from "sudo" command.Secrets: passwordPrompt
Result: successResult

Goal: Enter demo@10.0.7.138's password
Tool: Interactive password prompt from "sudo" command.Secrets: passwordPrompt
Result: successResult

Goal: Enter demo@10.0.7.138's password
Tool: Interactive password prompt from "sudo" command.Secrets: passwordPrompt
Result: successResult

Goal: Enter demo@10.0.7.138's password
Tool: Interactive password prompt from "sudo" command.Secrets: passwordPrompt
Result: successResult
